body_html: The only way to get the dynamic value of a tensor as a Python integer is to pass it to sess.run(). However, that doesn't really solve your problem, as you want to have data-dependent control flow in your graph. One way to do this is to upgrade to the latest nightly version of TensorFlow, and try the tf.foldl() or tf.foldr() functions, which operate like scan() in Theano to iterate over one dimension of a tensor.
body_text: The only way to get the dynamic value of a tensor as a Python integer is to pass it to sess.run(). However, that doesn't really solve your problem, as you want to have data-dependent control flow in your graph. One way to do this is to upgrade to the latest nightly version of TensorFlow, and try the tf.foldl() or tf.foldr() functions, which operate like scan() in Theano to iterate over one dimension of a tensor.
body: The only way to get the dynamic value of a tensor as a Python integer is to pass it to `sess.run()`. However, that doesn't really solve your problem, as you want to have data-dependent control flow in your graph. One way to do this is to upgrade to the latest nightly version of TensorFlow, and try the `tf.foldl()` or `tf.foldr()` functions, which operate like `scan()` in Theano to iterate over one dimension of a tensor.
